name: acceptation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the accepted meaning of a word: I may not be an athlete in the common acceptation of the word, but I enjoy regular workouts at the gym. He claimed that the word "emigrant" in its present acceptation was not then in use. Two interpretations can be equally legitimate when, by common acceptation, a term has acquired a secondary meaning.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was not using the word in its legal or business acceptation.We refer to a conditional fee, in the more general acceptation of the term.It is obvious that he is not talking of a "conscious intention", in the normal human acceptation of the phrase.The term has several acceptations.
